thread.title: BBC reveal shortlist of six X Factor FLOPS to represent UK in Eurovision 2017
thread.title_full: BBC reveal shortlist of six X Factor FLOPS to represent UK in Eurovision 2017

author: mirror
title: BBC reveal shortlist of six X Factor FLOPS to represent UK in Eurovision 2017
text:
BBC reveal shortlist of six X Factor FLOPS to represent UK in Eurovision 2017 Fans fear we're set for another disappointing year - especially after Brexit... Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Many of the Eurovision contestants have been on X Factor Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
This year's UK Eurovision entry looks set for nil points – after the BBC selected SIX finalists who've all flopped on rival show X Factor . 
The BBC today confirmed the acts that will compete for the honour of representing the United Kingdom at Eurovision 2017 in Kyiv, Ukraine. 
They include Danyl Johnson and Lucie Jones, who both got to the final of the ITV show in 2009, Salena Mastroianni, Holly Brewer, Olivia Garcia and Nate Simpson. 
They'll each battle it out on the event's 90-minute selection show, this Friday, which will be hosted by Mel Giedroyc and broadcast live on BBC Two from 7.30pm. 
But fans of the annual competition have already expressed concern. Specifically, because the last time BBC bosses chose an X Factor star was Andy Abrahams in 2008. He came last. Danyl Johnson is the most famous X Factor reject (Photo: ITV) Lucie Jones also tried her luck on the talent show, but failed (Photo: ITV) Nate Simpson is just a vague memory for most people (Photo: Splash News) Read More Katie Price's fans name her "queen of pop" after she takes centre stage on karaoke 
The six acts and songs - which can be heard via bbc.co.uk/eurovision - were revealed on BBC Radio 2’s Ken Bruce show, Monday, and have so far failed to impress listeners. 
One said: "The UK's Eurovision contenders have been revealed and we're definitely not going to win", while another hater added: "Oh my God, the UK's Eurovision song choices suck. They're just all so bland!" 
Another was even more cynical, saying: "It does not matter which song or group we choose it could be the best song by far we will never win!". 
Thankfully, they won't be the only performers on the night. 
An expert panel will be on hand to offer their thoughts on how the songs could be made to look and sound on stage in Kyiv. They are Bruno Tonioli, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and CeCe Sammy. 
Eurovision: You Decide will also feature two special music performances; the first from 2009 winner Alexander Rybak performing his classic song Fairytale, and the second, by British Pop Rock Band, The Vamps performing their song All Night. Read More Holly Brewer is also hoping that Eurovision will revive her career Olivia Garcia tried her luck, last year, but failed to make progress (Photo: ITV) Salena Mastroianni is also aiming for a mini miracle (Photo: ITV) Like us on Facebook
